original: slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang; chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur to //🔽sa bla na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / mchod pa dang /
analyzed: slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang; chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur to // sa bla na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / mchod pa dang /
translated: the upāsakas and upāsikās had also gathered in that assembly in order to see the Blessed One, to pay homage to him, to offer him their respect, to serve him, and to listen to the Dharma.🔽The devas of the earth, the devas of the desire realm, the devas of the form realm, and the Śuddhāvāsa devas had also gathered in that assembly in order to see the Blessed One, to pay homage to him, to offer him their respect, to serve him, and to listen to the Dharma.

original: bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur to; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das 'khor brgya stong du mas yongs su bskor cing mdun gyis bltas te /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur to; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das 'khor brgya stong du mas yongs su bskor cing mdun gyis bltas te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, surrounded by a retinue of hundreds of thousands,

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi tshogs rnam par dag pa'i sgo bsdu ba yongs su bskang ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi tshogs rnam par dag pa'i sgo bsdu ba yongs su bskang ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas teach the Dharma in order to complete the collection of the purification of the doors of the accumulations.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa'i tshogs ni sems can yongs su smin par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa'i tshogs ni sems can yongs su smin par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ accumulation of generosity brings sentient beings to maturity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims kyi tshogs ni smon lam yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims kyi tshogs ni smon lam yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ accumulation of morality fulfills their aspirations.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzod pa'i tshogs ni mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzod pa'i tshogs ni mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ accumulation of patience fulfills the major and minor marks.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus kyi tshogs ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus kyi tshogs ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ accumulation of effort fulfills all the qualities of a buddha.

original: @154b byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi tshogs ni cang shes kyi sems su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @154b byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi tshogs ni cang shes kyi sems su 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ accumulation of concentration is the mind of the noble ones.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi tshogs ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi tshogs ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of wisdom of the bodhisattvas becomes the abandonment of all afflictions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos bstan pa'i tshogs ni spobs pa thogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos bstan pa'i tshogs ni spobs pa thogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of Dharma teaching of the bodhisattvas becomes unobstructed eloquence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs ni sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs ni sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of merit of the bodhisattvas becomes the support for all sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs ni thogs pa med pa'i ye shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs ni thogs pa med pa'i ye shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of wisdom of the bodhisattvas becomes unobstructed wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas kyi tshogs ni sems las su rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas kyi tshogs ni sems las su rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of śamatha of the bodhisattvas becomes a serviceable mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag mthong gi tshogs ni the tshom dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag mthong gi tshogs ni the tshom dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of vipaśyanā of the bodhisattvas becomes freedom from doubt.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa'i tshogs ni zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa'i tshogs ni zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems su 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of love of the bodhisattvas becomes a mind free from hostility.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje'i tshogs ni yongs su mi skyo ba'i sems su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje'i tshogs ni yongs su mi skyo ba'i sems su 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ accumulation of compassion is the mind that never tires.

original: dga' ba'i tshogs ni chos kyis kun dga' la dga' zhing mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' ba'i tshogs ni chos kyis kun dga' la dga' zhing mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of joy is the delight and interest in the Dharma.

original: btang snyoms kyi tshogs ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi tshogs ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of equanimity is the abandonment of attachment and aversion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos mnyan pa'i tshogs ni sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur ro //🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par 'byung ba'i tshogs ni yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos mnyan pa'i tshogs ni sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur ro // byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par 'byung ba'i tshogs ni yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ accumulation of listening to the Dharma is the abandonment of obscurations.🔽The bodhisattvas’ accumulation of renunciation is the abandonment of all grasping.

original: byang chub @155a *//
analyzed: byang chub @155a *//
translated: The bodhisattvas’ accumulation of going forth is the abandonment of all grasping.

original: sems dpa' rnams kyi dgon pa la gnas pa'i tshogs ni byas pa'i las chud mi za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dpa' rnams kyi dgon pa la gnas pa'i tshogs ni byas pa'i las chud mi za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ accumulation of dwelling in the forest is the non-wastage of the work that is done.

original: dran pa'i tshogs ni gzungs thob par 'gyur ro; ;blo gros kyi tshogs ni blo rab tu 'byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa'i tshogs ni gzungs thob par 'gyur ro; ;blo gros kyi tshogs ni blo rab tu 'byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of mindfulness is the attainment of dhāraṇī. The accumulation of intelligence is the discernment of the mind.

original: rtogs pa'i tshogs ni don rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i tshogs ni don rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The collection of realizations is the following of the realization of the meaning.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i tshogs ni /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i tshogs ni /
translated: The collection of the applications of mindfulness is

original: lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos la so sor rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos la so sor rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: the discernment of body, feelings, mind, and phenomena.

original: yang dag par spong ba'i tshogs ni mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba'i tshogs ni mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The collection of the right efforts is the abandonment of all nonvirtuous phenomena and the completion of all virtuous phenomena.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i tshogs ni lus dang sems yang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i tshogs ni lus dang sems yang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The collection of the bases of supernatural powers is the lightness of body and mind.

original: dbang po lnga'i tshogs ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po lnga'i tshogs ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The collection of the five faculties is the knowledge of the superior and the non-superior.

original: stobs lnga'i tshogs ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi rdzi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stobs lnga'i tshogs ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi rdzi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The collection of the five powers is the non-subjugation by all the afflictions.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs ni chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs ni chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: The collection of the branches of enlightenment is the comprehension of all phenomena just as they are.

original: lam gyi tshogs ni lam ngan pa thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam gyi tshogs ni lam ngan pa thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of the path is the complete transcendence of all bad paths.

original: bden pa'i tshogs ni mi 'khrugs pa'i chos nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa'i tshogs ni mi 'khrugs pa'i chos nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of truth is the nature of unshakability.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa'i tshogs ni sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa'i tshogs ni sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of discernment is the cutting of the doubts of all sentient beings.

original: ston pa'i tshogs ni gzhan dag la rag ma las pa'i ye shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ston pa'i tshogs ni gzhan dag la rag ma las pa'i ye shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of teaching is the wisdom that does not depend on others.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen @155b gyi tshogs ni yon tan thams cad skye ba'i sgor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen @155b gyi tshogs ni yon tan thams cad skye ba'i sgor 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of spiritual friends is the door of the arising of all good qualities.

original: bsam pa'i tshogs ni 'jig rten thams cad la mi slu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa'i tshogs ni 'jig rten thams cad la mi slu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of intention is the non-deception of all worlds.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i tshogs ni khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i tshogs ni khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of superior intention is the progress of distinction.

original: sbyor ba'i tshogs ni ci rtsom pa thams cad nyams 'og tu chug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i tshogs ni ci rtsom pa thams cad nyams 'og tu chug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of application is the practice of all that is undertaken.

original: nang du yang dag 'jog gi tshogs ni ji skad thos pa'i chos chud mi gson par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nang du yang dag 'jog gi tshogs ni ji skad thos pa'i chos chud mi gson par 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of meditative equipoise is the non-forgetting of the Dharma as it has been heard.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po'i tshogs ni sems can yongs su smin par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po'i tshogs ni sems can yongs su smin par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of the means of attraction will bring about the ripening of sentient beings.

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'i tshogs ni dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi gcod par /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'i tshogs ni dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi gcod par /
translated: The accumulation of upholding the sublime Dharma will ensure the continuity of the lineage of the Three Jewels.

original: 'gyur ro // bsngo ba la mkhas pa'i tshogs ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // bsngo ba la mkhas pa'i tshogs ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of skill in dedication will bring about the purification of the buddhafields.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa'i tshogs ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa'i tshogs ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The accumulation of skill in means of the bodhisattvas will bring about the perfection of omniscient wisdom.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la tshogs rnam par dag pa'i sgo bsdu ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs rgyas par bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la tshogs rnam par dag pa'i sgo bsdu ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs rgyas par bshad do //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One extensively explained the Dharma discourse called “The Collection of the Doorways to the Pure Accumulations” to the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: tshogs rnam par dag pa'i sgo bsdu ba bstan pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: tshogs rnam par dag pa'i sgo bsdu ba bstan pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe /
translated: When this teaching of the collection of the doorways to the pure accumulations was explained,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas phyogs na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas phyogs na /
translated: on the right side of the Blessed One

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes rdo rje thogs nas 'dug par gyur to //
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes rdo rje thogs nas 'dug par gyur to //
translated: The Lord of Secrets, Vajrapāṇi, stood there holding his vajra.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽ji tsam du de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub sems @156a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to // ji tsam du de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub sems @156a *//
translated: Then the Lord of Secrets, Vajrapāṇi, said this to the Blessed One:

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi tshogs rnam par dag pa'i sgo bsdu ba zhes bgyi ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di legs par gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi tshogs rnam par dag pa'i sgo bsdu ba zhes bgyi ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di legs par gsungs pa ni /
translated: “The Thus-Gone One has excellently taught this Dharma discourse called ‘The Summary of the Purifying Approach of the Accumulations for the Bodhisattva Great Beings.’

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ngo mtshar lags so //
analyzed: ngo mtshar lags so //
translated: it is amazing!

original: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad bshad pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad bshad pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na /
translated: As I understand the meaning of what the Blessed One has said,

original: bdag 'di snyam du bgyid de /
analyzed: bdag 'di snyam du bgyid de /
translated: I think this:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi tshogs de dag thams cad ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi nang du 'dus shing rjes su zhugs par 'tshal bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi tshogs de dag thams cad ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi nang du 'dus shing rjes su zhugs par 'tshal bar bgyi'o //
translated: I understand that all those accumulations of the bodhisattva great beings are included in and subsumed by the accumulation of merit and the accumulation of wisdom.”

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs ni rnam par sgrub pa thams cad rnam par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs ni rnam par sgrub pa thams cad rnam par bsgrub bo //
translated: the accumulation of merit of bodhisattva great beings accomplishes all accomplishments.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs ni sems can thams cad legs par bshad pas tshim par bgyid do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs ni sems can thams cad legs par bshad pas tshim par bgyid do //
translated: The accumulation of wisdom satisfies all sentient beings with good explanations.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs la brtson par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs la brtson par bgyi'o //
translated: therefore, bodhisattva great beings should strive in the accumulation of merit and the accumulation of wisdom.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis ni /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis ni /
translated: through the accumulation of merit,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid do //
translated: bodhisattvas complete the perfection of skillful means.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs kyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid de /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs kyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid de /
translated: Through the accumulation of wisdom, they complete the perfection of wisdom.

original: @156b byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'di gnyis ni lam thams cad sdud par 'gyur ba lags so //
analyzed: @156b byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'di gnyis ni lam thams cad sdud par 'gyur ba lags so //
translated: These two bodhisattva paths include all paths.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa ni bdud sdig can gyis thul bar dka'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa ni bdud sdig can gyis thul bar dka'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the path is difficult for Māra to overcome.

original: bdud kyi las las yang dag par 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdud kyi las las yang dag par 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva who has transcended the activities of Māra will not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba thams cad ston te mi 'chab bo //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba thams cad ston te mi 'chab bo //
translated: The blessed buddhas reveal all the thusly gone secrets to the irreversible bodhisattva and do not conceal them.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhi ba'i blo gros kyis /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhi ba'i blo gros kyis /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Śāntamati

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said this to the lord of secrets Vajrapāṇi:

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po khyod ni /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po khyod ni /
translated: “Lord of Secrets, you

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs 'bring ba nye ba na 'dug pa yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs 'bring ba nye ba na 'dug pa yin na /
translated: are the thusly gone one’s attendant.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Secrets,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i gnas gang nyan thos dang / rangs sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa yang ma yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i gnas gang nyan thos dang / rangs sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa yang ma yin na /
translated: The domain of the secret of the Tathagata is not even the stage of all the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas,

original: de ma yin pa'i sems can tha mal lta smos kyang ci dgos pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i sems can tha mal lta smos kyang ci dgos pa las brtsams te /
translated: let alone ordinary beings.

original: khyod spobs par gyis shig /
analyzed: khyod spobs par gyis shig /
translated: Therefore, you should be confident!

original: @159b lam dang / tshangs pas 'dul ba'i sems can la tshangs pa'i spyod lam dang / 'jig rten skyong bas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la 'jig rten skyong ba'i spyod lam dang / 'khor los sgyur bas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /
analyzed: @159b lam dang / tshangs pas 'dul ba'i sems can la tshangs pa'i spyod lam dang / 'jig rten skyong bas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la 'jig rten skyong ba'i spyod lam dang / 'khor los sgyur bas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /
translated: He manifests the conduct of Brahmā for those beings who are to be guided by Brahmā, the conduct of the world guardians for those beings who are to be guided by the world guardians, and the conduct of a universal monarch for those beings who are to be guided by a universal monarch.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i spyod lam dang / dge slong gis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /🔽dge slong gi spyod lam dang / dge slong mas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i spyod lam dang / dge slong gis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la / dge slong gi spyod lam dang / dge slong mas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /
translated: He manifests the conduct of a fully ordained monk for those beings who are to be guided by a fully ordained monk,🔽the conduct of a fully ordained nun for those beings who are to be guided by a fully ordained nun,

original: dge slong ma'i spyod lam dang / dge bsnyen gyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i spyod lam dang / dge bsnyen gyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /
translated: and the conduct of a male or female lay practitioner for those beings who are to be guided by a male or female lay practitioner.

original: dge bsnyen gyi spyod lam dang / dge bsnyen mas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /🔽dge bsnyen ma'i spyod lam dang / nyan thos kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /
analyzed: dge bsnyen gyi spyod lam dang / dge bsnyen mas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la / dge bsnyen ma'i spyod lam dang / nyan thos kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /
translated: For those beings to be trained by the lay practitioner, he displays the conduct of a lay practitioner.🔽For those beings to be trained by the lay practitioner, he displays the conduct of a lay practitioner.

original: nyan thos kyi spyod lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi spyod lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /
translated: For those beings to be trained by the śrāvakas, he displays the conduct of a śrāvaka.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod lam dang / byang chub sems dpas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i spyod lam dang / de bzhin gshegs pas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod lam dang / byang chub sems dpas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod lam dang / de bzhin gshegs pas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la /
translated: For those beings to be trained by the pratyekabuddhas, he displays the conduct of a pratyekabuddha.🔽For those beings to be trained by the bodhisattvas, he displays the conduct of a bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam ston te /
translated: For those beings to be trained by the tathāgatas, he displays the conduct of a tathāgata.

original: gzugs med pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for the formless realm.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śantimatī,

original: de ltar sems can thams cad kyi gzugs dang / kha dog dang spyod lam ji snyed pa byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs dang / kha dog dang / spyod lam yang de snyed du lhun gyis grub cing yongs su mi rtog par kun tu gnas so //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' rnam par @160a *//
analyzed: de ltar sems can thams cad kyi gzugs dang / kha dog dang spyod lam ji snyed pa byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs dang / kha dog dang / spyod lam yang de snyed du lhun gyis grub cing yongs su mi rtog par kun tu gnas so // de la byang chub sems dpa' rnam par @160a *//
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva’s form, color, and deportment are spontaneously present and nonconceptually present in the same way as the forms, colors, and deportments of all sentient beings.

original: mi rtog cing btang snyoms pa de lus kyis lus kyi spyod lam ston mod kyi /
analyzed: mi rtog cing btang snyoms pa de lus kyis lus kyi spyod lam ston mod kyi /
translated: “Here, the bodhisattva, who is nonconceptual and equanimous, displays physical deportment with the body.

original: lus kyi chos nyid las kyang mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: lus kyi chos nyid las kyang mi g-yo'o //
translated: Yet he does not move from the reality of the body.

original: lus kyis lus kyi las byed mod kyi; lus kyi dben pa yang mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: lus kyis lus kyi las byed mod kyi; lus kyi dben pa yang mi 'dor ro //
translated: He performs physical actions with the body, yet he does not abandon the seclusion of the body.

original: de lus yongs su dag pas lus kyi 'od kyis sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can thams cad bde bar byed do //
analyzed: de lus yongs su dag pas lus kyi 'od kyis sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can thams cad bde bar byed do //
translated: With his pure body, he makes all the beings in the hells happy with the light of his body.

original: lus la mi lta bas sha za ba'i sems can ji snyed yod pa /
analyzed: lus la mi lta bas sha za ba'i sems can ji snyed yod pa /
translated: He does not look at the body, yet he gives his body to all the beings who eat flesh.

original: sha'i longs spyod gang dang gang 'dod pa de lta bu'i sha rnams bdag gis lus las de dag la bstabs nas /
analyzed: sha'i longs spyod gang dang gang 'dod pa de lta bu'i sha rnams bdag gis lus las de dag la bstabs nas /
translated: Whatever flesh they desire, whatever flesh they enjoy, I will give them that flesh from my body.

original: bdag srog dang phral te /
analyzed: bdag srog dang phral te /
translated: I will give my life to them.

original: sems can de dag la sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can de dag la sbyin par byed do //
translated: I will give my flesh to those who need flesh.

original: khrag 'thung ba rnams la khrag sbyin par byed do //🔽rkang za ba rnams la rkang sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: khrag 'thung ba rnams la khrag sbyin par byed do // rkang za ba rnams la rkang sbyin par byed do //
translated: I will give my blood to those who need blood.🔽I will give my bones to those who need bones.🔽I will give my marrow to those who need marrow.

original: gzi byin za ba rnams la gzi byin sbyin par byed de; ;zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: gzi byin za ba rnams la gzi byin sbyin par byed de; ;zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: de ltar sha'i longs spyod ji snyed par de dag thams cad bdag gi lus las bstabs te /
analyzed: de ltar sha'i longs spyod ji snyed par de dag thams cad bdag gi lus las bstabs te /
translated: I will give to all those who need flesh as much as they want from my body.

original: srog dang phral nas sems can de dag la sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: srog dang phral nas sems can de dag la sbyin par byed do //
translated: I will give my life to them.

original: de'i lus tshad med pa ni chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa'i rjes su 'gro bas mi zad do //
analyzed: de'i lus tshad med pa ni chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa'i rjes su 'gro bas mi zad do //
translated: His immeasurable body is inexhaustible because it follows the immeasurable realm of phenomena.

original: de'i lus mi zad pa mngon par sgrub pa ni /
analyzed: de'i lus mi zad pa mngon par sgrub pa ni /
translated: His accomplishment of an inexhaustible body

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mi zad pa mngon par bsgrubs pas rab tu rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mi zad pa mngon par bsgrubs pas rab tu rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: is known through his accomplishment of the inexhaustibility of dependent origination.

original: de lus kyis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: de lus kyis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: He ripens beings through his body.

original: gang dag 'dod chags la spyod pa sdug pa'i rnam pa dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i @160b sems can de dag gi mdun du bud med gzugs bzang zhing mdzes pa blta na sdug pa ston te /
analyzed: gang dag 'dod chags la spyod pa sdug pa'i rnam pa dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i @160b sems can de dag gi mdun du bud med gzugs bzang zhing mdzes pa blta na sdug pa ston te /
translated: In the presence of those beings who engage in desire and grasp at the characteristics of attractive forms, they manifest as women who are beautiful, attractive, and pleasant to behold.

original: de la sems can de dag chags pa skyes nas /
analyzed: de la sems can de dag chags pa skyes nas /
translated: Those beings become attached to them.

original: byugs shing kun tu byugs te /
analyzed: byugs shing kun tu byugs te /
translated: They smear themselves with it and anoint themselves with it.

original: de dag pang du 'jog go /
analyzed: de dag pang du 'jog go /
translated: They place them in their laps.

original: de dag skyes bu de dag gi pang du son pa dang / rnyis shing bskams nas 'chi ba'i dus byed do //
analyzed: de dag skyes bu de dag gi pang du son pa dang / rnyis shing bskams nas 'chi ba'i dus byed do //
translated: When those beings sit in the laps of those men, they wither and dry up and die.

original: mi gtsang zhing dri mi zhim par gyur pas /
analyzed: mi gtsang zhing dri mi zhim par gyur pas /
translated: They become filthy and foul-smelling.

original: skyes bu de dag des yid byung nas por te song ba dang / shi ba'i ro de dag nyid las skyes bu de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba'i chos bstan pa de lta bu 'byung ngo; ;yang zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: skyes bu de dag des yid byung nas por te song ba dang / shi ba'i ro de dag nyid las skyes bu de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba'i chos bstan pa de lta bu 'byung ngo; ;yang zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Those men become disgusted with them and leave. Then, from those corpses, teachings on the Dharma arise that cause those beings to become irreversible from unsurpassed and perfect awakening.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' de stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di lus kyis khyab par byas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di lus kyis khyab par byas te /
translated: That bodhisattva pervades this great trichiliocosm with his body.

original: sor mo'i rtse mos yungs 'bru la bya ba de bzhin du rin po che'i gdugs kyis khebs par byed do //
analyzed: sor mo'i rtse mos yungs 'bru la bya ba de bzhin du rin po che'i gdugs kyis khebs par byed do //
translated: He covers it with a jeweled parasol, as if it were an oil-seed plant.

original: sreg pa'i bskal pa'i me la lag pa'i sor mos g-yogs kyang de'i lus nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sreg pa'i bskal pa'i me la lag pa'i sor mos g-yogs kyang de'i lus nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He covers the fire of the conflagration at the end of the eon with the tip of his finger, without his body being harmed.

original: de'i lus kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la mchod cing rim gro byed de /
analyzed: de'i lus kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la mchod cing rim gro byed de /
translated: With his body he worships and serves the blessed buddhas.

original: me tog gi gdugs ri rab tsam dag kyang 'bul lo //
analyzed: me tog gi gdugs ri rab tsam dag kyang 'bul lo //
translated: He offers them flower parasols the size of Mount Meru.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir me tog gi skon bu dag kyang 'thor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir me tog gi skon bu dag kyang 'thor ro //
translated: He scatters flower garlands to worship the tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir de stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di spos kyi 'bru mar gyis gang ba'i snod gcig @161a *//🔽tu mos te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir de stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di spos kyi 'bru mar gyis gang ba'i snod gcig @161a *//🔽tu mos te /
translated: To worship the tathāgatas, he imagines that this great trichiliocosm is filled with a vessel of perfumed oil.

original: ri rab tsam gyi snying po 'bar bar byas pa'i mar me 'bar bar byed do //
analyzed: ri rab tsam gyi snying po 'bar bar byas pa'i mar me 'bar bar byed do //
translated: He made a lamp that burned with a wick the size of Mount Meru.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi mar me 'bar bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi mar me 'bar bar byed do //
translated: He lit lamps as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River in order to make offerings to the Tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir rang gi lus kyang ras bcos bus dkris nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir rang gi lus kyang ras bcos bus dkris nas /
translated: In order to make offerings to the Tathāgatas, he wrapped his own body in cotton cloth,

original: mar dang 'bru mar gyis bskus te /
analyzed: mar dang 'bru mar gyis bskus te /
translated: smeared it with sesame oil,

original: mar mer 'bud do //
analyzed: mar mer 'bud do //
translated: and lit it as a lamp.

original: de 'bar bar gyur pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos khyab par gyur te /
analyzed: de 'bar bar gyur pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos khyab par gyur te /
translated: When it was burning, the great light filled as many buddha-fields as there are sands of the Ganges River.

original: sems can dag gis kyang mthong zhing shes te /
analyzed: sems can dag gis kyang mthong zhing shes te /
translated: Sentient beings saw it and knew about it.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i khyu mchog tu gyur pa de mthong nas kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i khyu mchog tu gyur pa de mthong nas kyang /
translated: When they saw that bodhisattva-mahāsattva,

original: sems can tshad med grangs med pa dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: sems can tshad med grangs med pa dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: countless, innumerable sentient beings gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pas rlom pa'i sems can rnams la yang bdag gis gzugs tshan po che chen po dang / sred med kyi bu dang / lag na rdo rje'i gzugs su ston te /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pas rlom pa'i sems can rnams la yang bdag gis gzugs tshan po che chen po dang / sred med kyi bu dang / lag na rdo rje'i gzugs su ston te /
translated: I will manifest myself in the form of a great, powerful being, or as Nārāyaṇa or Vajrapāṇi, to those beings who are arrogant, conceited, and proud.

original: der sems can de dag sprul pas 'jigs skrag nas /
analyzed: der sems can de dag sprul pas 'jigs skrag nas /
translated: Those beings will be terrified by the emanations.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de la mngon par 'dud cing phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de la mngon par 'dud cing phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: They will bow down to the bodhisattva and pay homage to him.

original: de la chos kyang nyan par 'dod do //
analyzed: de la chos kyang nyan par 'dod do //
translated: They will want to listen to the Dharma.

original: gang yang grong khyer chen po dag gi dur khrod chen po srog chags brgya stong du mas gang bar gyur pa de yang /
analyzed: gang yang grong khyer chen po dag gi dur khrod chen po srog chags brgya stong du mas gang bar gyur pa de yang /
translated: “In the great charnel grounds of the great cities, which are filled with hundreds of thousands of living beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @161b des bdag gi lus chen po shi zhing dus las 'das par ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @161b des bdag gi lus chen po shi zhing dus las 'das par ston to //
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva will manifest his own great body, dead and passed away.

original: der yang sems can dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gyur pa de dag gis ci tsam du 'dod par sha la zos nas tshe'i mthar phyin te /
analyzed: der yang sems can dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gyur pa de dag gis ci tsam du 'dod par sha la zos nas tshe'i mthar phyin te /
translated: The beings who are in the animal realm will eat as much flesh as they want, and when they have finished their lives,

original: 'chi ba'i dus su gyur cing /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus su gyur cing /
translated: they will die.

original: shi nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha'i nang du skye'o //
analyzed: shi nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha'i nang du skye'o //
translated: After death, they will be reborn in the higher realms, in the celestial worlds.

original: de yang de dag gi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de dag gi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be the cause for their complete nirvāṇa.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' de nyid kyi sngon gyi smon lam yongs su dag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' de nyid kyi sngon gyi smon lam yongs su dag pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because the bodhisattva has pure aspirations from the past.

original: bdag 'chi ba'i dus su gyur nas /
analyzed: bdag 'chi ba'i dus su gyur nas /
translated: When I die,

original: shi ba'i lus la sems can gang dag gis zos pa de dag la de nyid mtho ris su skye ba nas /
analyzed: shi ba'i lus la sems can gang dag gis zos pa de dag la de nyid mtho ris su skye ba nas /
translated: may those beings who eat my dead body be reborn in the higher realms,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar gyi rgyur gyur cig /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar gyi rgyur gyur cig /
translated: and may this be the cause for their complete nirvāṇa.

original: ces yun ring po nas smon lam btab ste /
analyzed: ces yun ring po nas smon lam btab ste /
translated: For a long time, he has made aspirations such as these.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa de bsam pa 'grub /🔽'dod pa grub /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa de bsam pa 'grub / 'dod pa grub /
translated: The one who has discipline will accomplish his intentions,🔽accomplish his desires,

original: smon pa grub po //
analyzed: smon pa grub po //
translated: and accomplish his aspirations.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śantimat,

original: rnam grangs 'dis ci ltar byang chub sems dpa'i lus tshad med cing mtha' yas par khyod kyis 'di ltar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis ci ltar byang chub sems dpa'i lus tshad med cing mtha' yas par khyod kyis 'di ltar rig par bya ste /
translated: you should understand that in this way the bodhisattva’s body is immeasurable and infinite.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śantimat,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /
translated: In the past,

original: 'dzam bu'i gling du gtogs pa nam mkhas bskor ba 'di nyid du grong khyer brgyad khri bzhi stong pa phrag bzhi byung ste /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling du gtogs pa nam mkhas bskor ba 'di nyid du grong khyer brgyad khri bzhi stong pa phrag bzhi byung ste /
translated: in this very Jambudvīpa surrounded by the ocean, there were 348,000 cities.

original: de na grong dang / tshong 'dus dang / ri khrod stong phrag mang po srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po gnas pa yod de /
analyzed: de na grong dang / tshong 'dus dang / ri khrod stong phrag mang po srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po gnas pa yod de /
translated: There were many thousands of towns, markets, and empty mountain retreats inhabited by many hundreds of thousands of millions of living beings.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na /
translated: at that time,

original: nad chen po'i bskal pa par ma byung ste /🔽der sems can dag @162a *//
analyzed: nad chen po'i bskal pa par ma byung ste / der sems can dag @162a *//
translated: a great epidemic did not occur.🔽There,

original: nad sna tshogs kyis btab par gyur nas /
analyzed: nad sna tshogs kyis btab par gyur nas /
translated: beings were afflicted with various illnesses.

original: phal cher lus shu ba can dang / lus rnags pa dang / 'bras dang / phol mig dang / me dbal dang / thor bu dang; rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan gyi nad rnams kyis rgyas par gyur to //
analyzed: phal cher lus shu ba can dang / lus rnags pa dang / 'bras dang / phol mig dang / me dbal dang / thor bu dang; rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan gyi nad rnams kyis rgyas par gyur to //
translated: Most of them had leprosy, skin diseases, abscesses, boils, smallpox, wind disorders, bile disorders, and phlegm disorders.

original: de'i tshe sman pa stong phrag du ma sems can de dag gi nad de zhi bar bya ba'i phyir brtson par gyur kyang; sems can de dag gi nad de bsal bar ma nus so //
analyzed: de'i tshe sman pa stong phrag du ma sems can de dag gi nad de zhi bar bya ba'i phyir brtson par gyur kyang; sems can de dag gi nad de bsal bar ma nus so //
translated: At that time, even though thousands of physicians strove to cure the illness of those beings, they were unable to cure them.

original: der sems can de dag gis gso ba'i spyad ma rnyed de skyabs med rten med nas 'di skad du /🔽nad 'di las ni thar byed pa; ;lha'am klu'am dri za'am //
analyzed: der sems can de dag gis gso ba'i spyad ma rnyed de skyabs med rten med nas 'di skad du / nad 'di las ni thar byed pa; ;lha'am klu'am dri za'am //
translated: Then those beings, not finding any means of healing, without refuge or support, cried out:🔽“Who can save us from this illness,

original: gnod sbyin dang ni mi yang rung //
analyzed: gnod sbyin dang ni mi yang rung //
translated: whether god, nāga, gandharva,

original: mi ma yin pa su zhig yod //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa su zhig yod //
translated: yakṣa, human, or nonhuman?

original: sdug bsngal 'di las thar byed pa //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di las thar byed pa //
translated: Who can save us from this suffering?

original: de la nor rnams thams cad btang //
analyzed: de la nor rnams thams cad btang //
translated: We will give all our wealth

original: rjes su bstan pa bzhin du bya //
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa bzhin du bya //
translated: and do as we are instructed.

original: byas pa dag kyang gzo bar bya //
analyzed: byas pa dag kyang gzo bar bya //
translated: We will repay what we have done.”

original: zhes ku co cher 'don to //
analyzed: zhes ku co cher 'don to //
translated: They cried out in this way.

analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi de bzhin nyid do // phung po dang / khams dang / @165a *//
translated: The suchness of the past, the suchness of the future, and the suchness of the present are the suchness of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: skye mched kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: skye mched kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases is the suchness of affliction and purification.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of affliction and purification is the suchness of saṃsāra and nirvāṇa.

original: 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of saṃsāra and nirvāṇa is the suchness of non-formation.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang de nyid yin no //
translated: The suchness of non-conditioning is also the suchness of all conditioning.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni de kho na nyid dang / de lta bu nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / mi 'gyur ba nyid dang / mi 'byung ba nyid dang / rtsod pa med pa nyid dang / gzugs med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni de kho na nyid dang / de lta bu nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / mi 'gyur ba nyid dang / mi 'byung ba nyid dang / rtsod pa med pa nyid dang / gzugs med pa nyid do //
translated: suchness is reality, the way things are, non-differentiation, immutability, non-arising, non-dispute, and formlessness.

original: de bzhin nyid la gzugs gang yang med de /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gzugs gang yang med de /
translated: In suchness, there is no form at all.

original: gzugs med pa ni de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa ni de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Formlessness is called suchness.

original: ji ltar de bzhin nyid gzugs med pa de bzhin du gzugs thams cad kyang gzugs med pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin nyid gzugs med pa de bzhin du gzugs thams cad kyang gzugs med pa ste /
translated: Just as suchness is formless, so too all forms are formless.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la gzugs de ston kyang de bzhin nyid gzugs su mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la gzugs de ston kyang de bzhin nyid gzugs su mi byed do //
translated: Although bodhisattvas show that form to all sentient beings, they do not make suchness into form.

original: de gzugs med cing rtsod pa med kyang lus dang gzugs thams cad kyang ston te /
analyzed: de gzugs med cing rtsod pa med kyang lus dang gzugs thams cad kyang ston te /
translated: Although form is formless and non-disputed, they show all bodies and forms.

original: de bzhin nyid kyang 'khrugs par mi byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang 'khrugs par mi byed do //
translated: He does not disturb suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la rtog go /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la rtog go /
translated: He understands the body of the Tathāgata through the wisdom of suchness.

original: de bzhin gshegs @165b pa'i sku mnyam pa nyid kyis bdag gi lus mnyam pa nyid la rtog go /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @165b pa'i sku mnyam pa nyid kyis bdag gi lus mnyam pa nyid la rtog go /
translated: He understands the equality of his own body through the equality of the body of the Tathāgata.

original: lus ni shin tu ma skyes pa nyid yin pas lus thams cad ni lus med par yang dag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: lus ni shin tu ma skyes pa nyid yin pas lus thams cad ni lus med par yang dag par mthong ngo //
translated: He sees that all bodies are bodiless, because the body is utterly unborn.

original: lus thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: lus thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows that all bodies are dependently originated.

original: shes nas kyang chos kyi sku mngon par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: shes nas kyang chos kyi sku mngon par bsgrub bo //
translated: Knowing that, he accomplishes the body of the Dharma.

original: de chos kyi sku mngon par bsgrubs pas chos kyi sku nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de chos kyi sku mngon par bsgrubs pas chos kyi sku nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Having accomplished the body of the Dharma, he becomes the body of the Dharma.

original: phung po dang; khams dang / skye mched kyi lus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po dang; khams dang / skye mched kyi lus ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not a body of aggregates, elements, or sense bases.

original: de chos kyi sku rab tu phye bas na mthong bas kyang sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: de chos kyi sku rab tu phye bas na mthong bas kyang sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: He benefits sentient beings through being seen, because he is distinguished by the body of the Dharma.

original: thos pa dang / reg pas kyang sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: thos pa dang / reg pas kyang sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: He benefits sentient beings through being heard and touched.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dper na / sman pa'i rgyal po 'tsho byed kyis rtsi thams cad bsdus te / rtsi'i shing mang po las bu mo'i gzugs bzang zhing mdzes pa /
translated: For example, the king of physicians, Jivaka, gathered all the herbs🔽and from many medicinal trees he created the form of a beautiful,

analyzed: blta na sdug pa legs par byas te /

analyzed: legs par zin cing legs par byi dor byas pa de 'ong ba'am /

original: 'gro ba'am / 'greng ngam /
analyzed: 'gro ba'am / 'greng ngam /
translated: whether she came, went, stood,

original: 'dug gam / nyal yang rtog pa med cing rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: 'dug gam / nyal yang rtog pa med cing rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: sat, or lay down, she was without thought and without conceptualization.

original: der nad pa gang btsun pa'am /
analyzed: der nad pa gang btsun pa'am /
translated: Then, whatever sick people came there, whether they were of noble birth,🔽kings, great royal ministers,

original: rgyal po'am / rgyal po'i blon po chen po'am /🔽rgyal po'i bu'am /
analyzed: rgyal po'am / rgyal po'i blon po chen po'am / rgyal po'i bu'am /
translated: princes,

original: tshong dpon nam /
analyzed: tshong dpon nam /
translated: merchants,

analyzed: khyim bdag gam /

analyzed: blon po'am / rgyal phran gang dag 'ong ba de dag sman pa'i rgyal po 'tsho byed kyis sman gyi bu mo de dang sprad nas /

analyzed: de dag phrad ma thag tu nad thams cad byang ste / nad med cing bde la /

analyzed: nyams pa med par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros / gang sman pa @166a *//
translated: Śāntamati,

analyzed: gzhan la med pa sman pa'i rgyal po 'tsho byed kyi 'jig rten gyi nad gso ba'i shes pa la ltos /
translated: consider the knowledge of the king of physicians, Jīvaka, who is unmatched by other physicians in healing the diseases of the world.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi skus rab tu phye ba yang sems can bud med dang / skyes pa dang / khye'u dang / bu mo 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis yongs su gdungs pa ji snyed yod pa de dag gis lus la reg na reg ma thag tu de dag gi nyon mongs pa thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi skus rab tu phye ba yang sems can bud med dang / skyes pa dang / khye'u dang / bu mo 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis yongs su gdungs pa ji snyed yod pa de dag gis lus la reg na reg ma thag tu de dag gi nyon mongs pa thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, when all the beings who are afflicted by desire, anger, and ignorance—women, men, boys, and girls—touch the body of a bodhisattva who is distinguished by the body of the Dharma, as soon as they touch it, all their afflictions are cut off.

original: lus yongs su gdung ba dang bral bar yang shes so //
analyzed: lus yongs su gdung ba dang bral bar yang shes so //

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de nyid kyi sngon gyi smon lam shin tu dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de nyid kyi sngon gyi smon lam shin tu dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the bodhisattva’s previous aspirations are extremely pure.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: chos kyi skus rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi skus rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
translated: because he is distinguished by the body of the Dharma,

original: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' lus kyi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' lus kyi gsang ba'o //
translated: This, Śāntamati, is the secret of the bodhisattvas’ bodies.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi sku dang ldan pa rnams kyi lus ni zas skom gyis bskyed pa ma yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi sku dang ldan pa rnams kyi lus ni zas skom gyis bskyed pa ma yin /
translated: the bodies of bodhisattvas who possess the body of the Dharma are not produced by food and drink.

original: kham gyis za ba'i zas kyis kyang lus 'tsho ba ma yin te /
analyzed: kham gyis za ba'i zas kyis kyang lus 'tsho ba ma yin te /

original: de zas thams cad yongs su shes pa dang ldan pas sems can la snying brtse ba'i phyir zas za'o //🔽de zas za'ang mid pa ma yin /
analyzed: de zas thams cad yongs su shes pa dang ldan pas sems can la snying brtse ba'i phyir zas za'o // de zas za'ang mid pa ma yin /
translated: They eat food out of compassion for sentient beings, and because they have complete knowledge of all foods.🔽Even though they eat food, they do not swallow it.

original: za'ang khong du 'jug par mi byed do //
analyzed: za'ang khong du 'jug par mi byed do //
translated: Even though they eat, they do not ingest it.

original: chos kyi sku'i stobs kyis mi nyams /
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i stobs kyis mi nyams /
translated: They do not diminish it through the power of the body of the Dharma.🔽They do not diminish it at all.

original: yongs su mi nyams so; ;zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams so; ;zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi sku dang ldan pa la skye ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / 'byung ba med kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi sku dang ldan pa la skye ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / 'byung ba med kyang /
translated: bodhisattvas who possess the body of the Dharma do not take birth, die, or reappear.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir skye ba dang @166b 'chi 'pho dang / 'byung ba yang ston to //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir skye ba dang @166b 'chi 'pho dang / 'byung ba yang ston to //
translated: But in order to ripen sentient beings, they demonstrate birth, death, and reappearance.

original: de 'chi 'pho yang chos thams cad la 'chi 'pho med cing mngon par 'du byed pa med par rab tu shes so //🔽'byung yang chos thams cad la 'pho ba med par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de 'chi 'pho yang chos thams cad la 'chi 'pho med cing mngon par 'du byed pa med par rab tu shes so // 'byung yang chos thams cad la 'pho ba med par rab tu shes so //
translated: Although they die and transmigrate, they know that all phenomena are without death and transmigration and are not conditioned.

original: skye yang chos thams cad la skye ba med par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: skye yang chos thams cad la skye ba med par rab tu shes so //
translated: Although they are born, they know that all phenomena are without birth.

original: de chos kyi sku dang ldan /
analyzed: de chos kyi sku dang ldan /
translated: They possess the body of the Dharma,🔽the food of the Dharma,

original: chos kyi zas dang ldan /
analyzed: chos kyi zas dang ldan /
translated: and the strength of the Dharma.🔽They know the body of the Tathāgata🔽through relying on the Dharma.

analyzed: chos kyi stobs dang ldan zhing chos la rton pas /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rab tu shes te /
translated: the body that is equal to the unequalled,🔽the body that is superior to the three worlds,🔽the body that possesses the suchness of all sentient beings,🔽the incomparable body,🔽the body that is without likeness,🔽the pure body, the stainless body,🔽the body that is without affliction,🔽the body that is without attachment,🔽the body that is without grasping,🔽the body that is without birth,🔽the body that is without death,

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: the body that is without sickness,🔽the body that is without aging,🔽the body that is without defilement,🔽the body that is without stains,🔽the body that is without afflictions,🔽the body that is without obscurations,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni nam mkha'i sku /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni nam mkha'i sku /
translated: the body that is without darkness,🔽the body that is without ignorance,🔽the body that is without delusion,

analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sku / 'jig rten gsum po thams cad las bye brag tu 'phags pa'i sku /
translated: the body that is without confusion,🔽the body that is without doubt,🔽the body that is without uncertainty,🔽the body that is without fear,🔽the body that is without terror,

original: sems can thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang ldan pa'i sku /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang ldan pa'i sku /
translated: the body that is without agitation,🔽the body that is without anger,

original: dpe med pa /🔽'dra ba med pa /
analyzed: dpe med pa / 'dra ba med pa /
translated: the body that is without hostility,🔽the body that is without jealousy,🔽the body that is without miserliness,🔽the body that is without deceit,🔽the body that is without pretense,🔽the body that is without arrogance,

original: dag pa / dri ma med pa /
analyzed: dag pa / dri ma med pa /
translated: the body that is without pride,🔽the body that is without haughtiness,🔽the body that is without laziness,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sku /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sku /
translated: the body that is without distraction,🔽the body that is without forgetfulness,🔽the body that is without dullness,🔽the body that is without non-conscientiousness,🔽the body that is without non-faith,🔽the body that is without non-devotion,🔽the body that is without non-respect,🔽the body that is without non-reverence,🔽the body that is without non-fear,🔽the body that is without non-terror,🔽the body that is without non-

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sku / rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i sku /
translated: the body that is naturally luminous,🔽the body that is naturally unborn,

original: rang bzhin gyis ma byung ba'i sku /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma byung ba'i sku /
translated: the body that is naturally non-arisen,

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa dang ma 'brel ba'i sku /
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa dang ma 'brel ba'i sku /
translated: the body that is not connected with mind, thought, or consciousness,

analyzed: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla'i ngo bo nyid kyi sku /
translated: the body that is the essence of an illusion, a mirage, and the reflection of the moon in water,

analyzed: stong pa nyid dang; mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la nges par btags pa'i sku /

analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling yang rung /

analyzed: grong dang; grong khyer dang / grong brdal dang / yul 'khor dang / pho brang 'khor de ji snyed yod pa thams cad du /

analyzed: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / rtogs pa dang / rnam par rig pas rab tu phye ba yang ma yin no //

analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya bas rab tu phye ba yin yang /

analyzed: lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa las kyang mi nyams yongs su mi nyams so //

analyzed: de lus mi rtag pa dang / lus sdug bsngal ba dang / lus bdag med par yang sems can rnams la ston la /

original: lus kyi zhi ba'i chos nyid kyang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: lus kyi zhi ba'i chos nyid kyang rab tu shes so //

original: de lus rab tu dbye ba yang sems can rnams la ston la /
analyzed: de lus rab tu dbye ba yang sems can rnams la ston la /

original: rgyu gang dang dmigs pa gang dag gis lus mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu de dag dang / dmigs pa de dag kyang byed pa po med pa dang; tshor ba po med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //

translated: And he sees that the causes and the objects through which the body is produced are without an agent and without a subject of experience.

analyzed: lus rtsva dang / shing dang / rtsig pa dang / lam dang / mig yor lta bur yang rab tu shes shing /

analyzed: de lus kyi las yongs su dag par yang sems can rnams la ston te /

analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad tshun chad /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi gsang ba dang / lus kyi las yongs su dag pa'o //

analyzed: de bas lhag par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi las yongs su dag pa bskal pa brgya stong ngam /

original: de bas kyang lhag par bstan to //
analyzed: de bas kyang lhag par bstan to //
translated: or even more than that.

original: @168a *// zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: @168a *// zhi ba'i blo gros /

analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi gsang ba gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal par bstan kyang zad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: if the Thus-Gone One were to teach the bodhisattvas’ secret of the body for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River, it would not come to an end.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi gsang ba bstan pa ni de tsam du tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //

original: des pa'i le'u ste dang po'o ////
analyzed: des pa'i le'u ste dang po'o ////

analyzed: bam po gnyis pa; gzhan yang gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes byang chub sems dpa' zhi ba'i blo gros la 'di skad ces smras so // zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Furthermore, Guhyapati Vajrapāṇi said to the bodhisattva Śāntamati, “Śāntamati,

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i ngag gi gsang ba dang / ngag gi las yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyes pa'i rabs ji snyed par sgra la 'jug pa'ang de snyed do //

analyzed: de dag gi mngon par shes pa de ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis rtogs par dka' ba'o //

original: de dag gi mngon par shes pa de ni don zab cing /
analyzed: de dag gi mngon par shes pa de ni don zab cing /
