analyzed: bdud phyir rgol ba bcom pa'o //
translated: and it conquers the māras and adversaries.

original: de dag gi mngon par shes pa de ni byang chub kyi snying po bsgrub cing /
analyzed: de dag gi mngon par shes pa de ni byang chub kyi snying po bsgrub cing /
translated: Their supernormal knowledge is the supreme attainment of the essence of awakening,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos @174b thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos @174b thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: and it is the full realization of all the qualities of a buddha.

original: de dag gi mngon par shes pa de ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mngon par shes pa de ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Their supernormal knowledge is in accord with turning the wheel of the Dharma.

original: de dag gi mngon par shes pa de ni sems can thams cad 'dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mngon par shes pa de ni sems can thams cad 'dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: Their superknowledge is the taming of all sentient beings.

original: de dag gi mngon par shes pa de ni chos thams cad la dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang bskur ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mngon par shes pa de ni chos thams cad la dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang bskur ba thob pa'o //
translated: Their superknowledge is the attainment of consecration, because they have mastery over all phenomena.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyi las yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyi las yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Śāntamati, this is the bodhisattvas’ pure mental activity.

original: sems yongs su dag pa de nyon mongs pa med cing yongs su bya ba dang / 'od gsal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / rab tu dul ba dang / legs par sbyangs pas bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang /
analyzed: sems yongs su dag pa de nyon mongs pa med cing yongs su bya ba dang / 'od gsal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / rab tu dul ba dang / legs par sbyangs pas bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang /
translated: With that pure mind, they are free from afflictions, and their actions are clear, free from secondary afflictions, well disciplined, and well trained.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par 'jog kyang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par 'jog kyang /
translated: They rest in equipoise in the concentrations, liberations,🔽absorptions, and attainments.

original: shin tu zad pa dang / mi skye ba nyid du ltung ba yang ma yin //
analyzed: shin tu zad pa dang / mi skye ba nyid du ltung ba yang ma yin //
translated: But they do not fall into the extreme of complete cessation or non-arising.

original: bsam bzhin du yang 'dir skye la /
analyzed: bsam bzhin du yang 'dir skye la /
translated: They are born here intentionally.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na 'khrugs pa yang med pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na 'khrugs pa yang med pa /
translated: They are not disturbed by the desire realm.

original: bcings pa bzhin du skye ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bcings pa bzhin du skye ba yang ma yin /
translated: He is not born as if bound.

original: bcings bzhin du 'chi 'pho ba yang ma yin //
analyzed: bcings bzhin du 'chi 'pho ba yang ma yin //
translated: He does not die as if bound.

original: bcings bzhin du 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bcings bzhin du 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: He does not appear as if bound.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa las grol ba'o //🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba'o //
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa las grol ba'o // kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba'o //
translated: He is liberated from false imagination.🔽He is liberated from the bonds of defilement.

original: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa las grol ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa las grol ba'o //
translated: He is liberated from the basis of perverted grasping.

original: des na grol bzhin du skye'o //
analyzed: des na grol bzhin du skye'o //
translated: Therefore, he is born as if liberated.

original: grol bzhin du 'chi 'pho'o //
analyzed: grol bzhin du 'chi 'pho'o //
translated: He dies as if liberated.

original: grol bzhin du 'byung ngo //🔽de skye yang theg pa chen po las @175a *//
analyzed: grol bzhin du 'byung ngo // de skye yang theg pa chen po las @175a *//
translated: He appears as if liberated.

original: nyams pa med la /
analyzed: nyams pa med la /
translated: Although he is born, he does not fall away from the Great Vehicle.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyis kyang phun sum tshogs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyis kyang phun sum tshogs so //
translated: He is also endowed with all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: phyogs bcur sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag yongs su tshol yang mi rnyed; mi dmigs so //
analyzed: phyogs bcur sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag yongs su tshol yang mi rnyed; mi dmigs so //
translated: Even if he were to seek those qualities of the Buddha in the ten directions, he would not find them, nor would he apprehend them.

original: de sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang chos thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos su rtogs so //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang chos thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos su rtogs so //
translated: He understands that the qualities of the Buddha and all phenomena are the qualities of the Buddha.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / chos thams cad kyang chos ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / chos thams cad kyang chos ma yin la /
translated: Thus, the Buddha’s Dharma and all dharmas are not dharmas.

original: chos ma yin pa yang ma yin par khas len to //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa yang ma yin par khas len to //
translated: And it is accepted that they are not non-dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ni kun du btsal na yang mi rnyed do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni kun du btsal na yang mi rnyed do //
translated: All dharmas, when sought, are not found.

original: mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi dmigs so //
translated: They are not apprehended.

original: chos gang yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du btsal na mi rnyed cing /
analyzed: chos gang yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du btsal na mi rnyed cing /
translated: When any dharma is sought in accordance with reality, it is not found and is not apprehended.

original: mi dmigs pa de la ni bgrang ba gang yang med de /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de la ni bgrang ba gang yang med de /
translated: That which is not found and is not apprehended is not counted at all.

original: chos thams cad ni bgrang ba'i lam las yang dag par 'das pa'o //🔽gang chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa de ni chos sam /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bgrang ba'i lam las yang dag par 'das pa'o // gang chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa de ni chos sam /
translated: All dharmas are beyond the path of counting.

original: chos ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: One who knows the equality of all dharmas has no attachment to dharmas or non-dharmas.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa ni chos rnams kyi don to //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa ni chos rnams kyi don to //
translated: Non-attachment is the meaning of dharmas.

original: don la rlom sems su byed pa gang yin pa de nyid de'i gnod pa chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don la rlom sems su byed pa gang yin pa de nyid de'i gnod pa chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: Any conceptualization of the meaning is itself a great injury.

original: gang la rlom sems med pa la ni don dang / don ma yin pa de'i mdun na mi 'dug go //
analyzed: gang la rlom sems med pa la ni don dang / don ma yin pa de'i mdun na mi 'dug go //
translated: For one who is not conceited, there is no question of right or wrong.

original: don du mi blta ba'i blo ni gang du yang thogs pa med do //
analyzed: don du mi blta ba'i blo ni gang du yang thogs pa med do //
translated: The mind that does not see anything does not encounter any obstacle.

original: de na blo thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de na blo thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no obstacle for the mind.

original: gang blo thogs pa med pa de ni chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang blo thogs pa med pa de ni chags pa med pa'o //
translated: Where there is no obstacle for the mind, there is no attachment.

original: gang chags pa med pa de ni rgyun chad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang chags pa med pa de ni rgyun chad pa med pa'o //
translated: Where there is no attachment, there is no interruption.

original: gang rgyun chad med pa de ni nyams pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang rgyun chad med pa de ni nyams pa med pa'o //
translated: Where there is no interruption, there is no falling away.

original: @175b gang nyams pa med pa de ni btsal ba don med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @175b gang nyams pa med pa de ni btsal ba don med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Where there is no falling away, there is no point in searching.

original: gang gi btsal ba don med par mi 'gyur ba de la skyon med do //
analyzed: gang gi btsal ba don med par mi 'gyur ba de la skyon med do //
translated: Where there is no point in searching, there is no fault.

original: gang la skyon med pa de la bdag gi ba med do //
analyzed: gang la skyon med pa de la bdag gi ba med do //
translated: Where there is no fault, there is no possessiveness.

original: gang la bdag gi ba med pa de la yongs su 'dzin pa med do //🔽gang la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa de la rtsod pa med do //
analyzed: gang la bdag gi ba med pa de la yongs su 'dzin pa med do // gang la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa de la rtsod pa med do //
translated: Where there is no possessiveness, there is no grasping.🔽Where there is no grasping, there is no dispute.

original: gang la rtsod pa med pa de la 'gyed pa med do //
analyzed: gang la rtsod pa med pa de la 'gyed pa med do //
translated: Where there is no dispute, there is no quarrel.

original: gang la 'gyed pa med pa de ni rtsod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gang la 'gyed pa med pa de ni rtsod pa med pa ste /
translated: He who is free from dispute is free from conflict.

original: dge sbyong gi chos dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He who is free from conflict is said to possess the qualities of an ascetic.

original: gang dge sbyong gi chos dang ldan pa de nam mkha' dang lag mthil du mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: gang dge sbyong gi chos dang ldan pa de nam mkha' dang lag mthil du mnyam pa'o //
translated: He who possesses the qualities of an ascetic is equal to the sky and the palm of the hand.

original: gang nam mkha' dang lags mthil du mnyam pa de ni 'dod pa'i khams su mi gtogs so //
analyzed: gang nam mkha' dang lags mthil du mnyam pa de ni 'dod pa'i khams su mi gtogs so //
translated: He who is equal to the sky and the palm of the hand is not included in the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams su mi gtogs so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su mi gtogs so //
translated: He is not included in the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su mi gtogs so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su mi gtogs so //
translated: He is not included in the formless realm.

original: gang thams cad du gtogs pa ma yin pa de la ni kha dog med /
analyzed: gang thams cad du gtogs pa ma yin pa de la ni kha dog med /
translated: He who is not included in anything has no color,

original: rtags med / dbyibs med do //
analyzed: rtags med / dbyibs med do //
translated: no sign, and no shape.

original: gang la kha dog med /
analyzed: gang la kha dog med /
translated: He who has no color,

original: rtags med / dbyibs med pa de ni de 'dra ba nyid rjes su rtogs so //
analyzed: rtags med / dbyibs med pa de ni de 'dra ba nyid rjes su rtogs so //
translated: no sign, and no shape realizes suchness.

original: de ci 'dra ba rjes su rtogs pa de 'dra ba nyid rab tu rtogs so //
analyzed: de ci 'dra ba rjes su rtogs pa de 'dra ba nyid rab tu rtogs so //
translated: He who realizes suchness realizes the suchness of realization.

original: ci'i phyir rjes su rtogs pa dang / rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rjes su rtogs pa dang / rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called realization and full realization?

original: de la rjes su rtogs par bya ba'am /
analyzed: de la rjes su rtogs par bya ba'am /
translated: There is nothing to be realized

original: rab tu rtogs par bya ba'i chos phra rab tsam yang mi dmigs pas de'i phyir rjes su rtogs pa dang / rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rab tu rtogs par bya ba'i chos phra rab tsam yang mi dmigs pas de'i phyir rjes su rtogs pa dang / rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since not even the subtlest phenomenon to be realized can be observed, it is called ‘realization’ and ‘complete realization.’

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śhāntimatī,

original: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyi gsang ba'o //
translated: this is also a secret of the bodhisattvas’ minds.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /🔽gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i @176a *//
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i @176a *//
translated: Śhāntimatī,

original: sems kyi gsang ba ni /
analyzed: sems kyi gsang ba ni /
translated: furthermore, a secret of the bodhisattvas’ minds

original: gang byams pa yang yin la bdag med pa nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: gang byams pa yang yin la bdag med pa nyid kyang yin /
translated: is that they are loving and yet have no self.

original: snying rje yang yin la sems can med pa nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: snying rje yang yin la sems can med pa nyid kyang yin /
translated: They are compassionate and yet have no sentient beings.

original: dga' ba yang yin la srog med pa nyid kyang yin /🔽btang snyoms kyang yin la /
analyzed: dga' ba yang yin la srog med pa nyid kyang yin / btang snyoms kyang yin la /
translated: They are joyful and yet have no life force.

original: gang zag med pa nyid kyang yin /🔽sbyin pa yang yin la sems dul ba nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: gang zag med pa nyid kyang yin / sbyin pa yang yin la sems dul ba nyid kyang yin /
translated: They are impartial and yet have no person.🔽They are generous and yet have a disciplined mind.

original: tshul khrims kyang yin la sems zhi ba nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyang yin la sems zhi ba nyid kyang yin /
translated: They are ethical and yet have a peaceful mind.

original: bzod pa yang yin la sems mi zad pa nyid kyang yin //
analyzed: bzod pa yang yin la sems mi zad pa nyid kyang yin //
translated: They are patient and yet have an inexhaustible mind.

original: brtson 'grus kyang yin la sems dben pa nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyang yin la sems dben pa nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is diligence and a mind that is isolated.

original: bsam gtan yang yin la sems nges par sems pa nyid kyang yin //
analyzed: bsam gtan yang yin la sems nges par sems pa nyid kyang yin //
translated: It is meditative stability and a mind that is focused on certainty.

original: shes rab kyang yin la rgyu ba med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /🔽dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang yin la dran pa yid la byed pa med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin; yang dag par spong ba rnams kyang yin la /
analyzed: shes rab kyang yin la rgyu ba med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang yin la dran pa yid la byed pa med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin; yang dag par spong ba rnams kyang yin la /
translated: It is insight and a mind that is without movement.🔽It is the applications of mindfulness and a mind that is without mental activity.

original: yang dag par sems mnyam pa nyid kyang yin /🔽rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyang yin la /
analyzed: yang dag par sems mnyam pa nyid kyang yin / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyang yin la /
translated: It is the correct exertions and a mind that is correctly balanced.

original: spros pa med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is the bases of miraculous power and a mind that is without conceptual elaboration.

original: dad pa yang yin la chags pa med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: dad pa yang yin la chags pa med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is faith and a mind that is without attachment.

original: brtson 'grus kyang yin la lhun gyis grub pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyang yin la lhun gyis grub pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is diligence and a mind that is spontaneous.

original: dran pa yang yin la rang 'byung gi sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: dran pa yang yin la rang 'byung gi sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is mindfulness and a mind that is self-arisen.

original: ting nge 'dzin kyang yin la mnyam pa nyid shes pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin kyang yin la mnyam pa nyid shes pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is absorption and a mind that knows sameness.

original: shes rab kyi dbang po yang yin la dbang po med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po yang yin la dbang po med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is the faculty of wisdom and also the mind that is not a faculty.

original: dbang po rnams @176b kyang yin la chos thams cad la dbang po med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: dbang po rnams @176b kyang yin la chos thams cad la dbang po med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is the faculties and also the mind that is not a faculty in all phenomena.

original: stobs rnams kyang yin la mi rdzi ba'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: stobs rnams kyang yin la mi rdzi ba'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is the powers and also the mind that is not overcome.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyang yin la blos rab tu 'byed pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyang yin la blos rab tu 'byed pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is the branches of enlightenment and also the mind that is discerned by the mind.

original: lam bsgom pa nyid kyang yin la bsgom pa med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: lam bsgom pa nyid kyang yin la bsgom pa med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is the cultivation of the path and also the mind that is without cultivation.

original: zhi gnas kyang yin la sems nye bar zhi ba nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyang yin la sems nye bar zhi ba nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is calm abiding and also the mind that is at peace.

original: lhag mthong yang yin la rjes su mi mthong ba'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: lhag mthong yang yin la rjes su mi mthong ba'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is insight and also the mind that does not see anything.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bsgom pa la yang yin la shin tu yongs su shes pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bsgom pa la yang yin la shin tu yongs su shes pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is the cultivation of the noble truths and also the mind that is completely understood.

original: sangs rgyas yid la byed pa yang yin la yid la byed pa med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas yid la byed pa yang yin la yid la byed pa med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is the attention on the Buddha and also the mind that is without attention.

original: chos yid la byed pa yang yin la chos kyi dbyings su mnyam pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: chos yid la byed pa yang yin la chos kyi dbyings su mnyam pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is the mental activity of Dharma, and it is the mind that is the same as the realm of phenomena.

original: dge 'dun yid la byed pa yang yin la mi gnas pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: dge 'dun yid la byed pa yang yin la mi gnas pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is the mental activity of Saṅgha, and it is the mind that does not abide.

original: sems can yongs su smin par yang byed la bzod ma nas dag pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par yang byed la bzod ma nas dag pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It brings beings to maturity, and it is the mind that is pure from the beginning.

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa yang yin la; chos kyi dbyings dang / dbyer med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa yang yin la; chos kyi dbyings dang / dbyer med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It upholds the sublime Dharma, and it is the mind that is inseparable from the realm of phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa yang yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa yang yin la /
translated: It purifies the buddha realms,

original: sems nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: sems nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyang yin /
translated: and it is the mind that is equal to space.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa yang yin la /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa yang yin la /
translated: It is the acceptance of the unborn nature of phenomena,

original: mi dmigs pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: and it is the mind that is free from observation.🔽It is the irreversible level,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa yang yin la ldog pa dang 'jug pa med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa yang yin la ldog pa dang 'jug pa med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: and it is the mind that does not turn back or engage.

original: mtshan rab tu thob pa yang @177a *//
analyzed: mtshan rab tu thob pa yang @177a *//
translated: It is the attainment of the excellent marks,

original: yin la mtshan ma med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: yin la mtshan ma med pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: and it is the mind that is free from marks.

original: byang chub kyi snying po'i rgyan nyid kyang yin la khams gsum gyi snying po'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po'i rgyan nyid kyang yin la khams gsum gyi snying po'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is the ornament of the essence of enlightenment and the essence of the mind of the three realms.

original: bdud tshar gcod pa yang yin la sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: bdud tshar gcod pa yang yin la sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is the one who conquers the demons and the mind that benefits all sentient beings.

original: byang chub kyang yin la chos thams cad ni dngos po med par khong du chud pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: byang chub kyang yin la chos thams cad ni dngos po med par khong du chud pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is enlightenment and the mind that understands that all phenomena are unreal.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang yin la mi 'jug mi ldog pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang yin la mi 'jug mi ldog pa'i sems nyid kyang yin /
translated: It is the one who turns the wheel of Dharma and the mind that neither engages nor disengages.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po yang ston la 'khor ba'i rang bzhin dang mnyam pa'i sems nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po yang ston la 'khor ba'i rang bzhin dang mnyam pa'i sems nyid kyang yin te /

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /

analyzed: lha dang mi kha cig nyal ba gtso bor byed pa de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa mnal bar mthong ngo //
translated: Some gods and humans, who make lying down the most important thing, see the Tathāgata as lying down.

analyzed: lha dang mi kha cig mig mi 'dzum par blta ba gtso bor byed pa de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa spyan mi 'dzum par gzigs pa mthong ngo //
translated: Some gods and humans, who make gazing without winking the most important thing, see the Tathāgata as gazing without winking.

original: lha dang mi kha cig 'dzum pa byed pa gtso bor 'dzin pa @193b de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'dzum pa mdzad par mthong ngo //
analyzed: lha dang mi kha cig 'dzum pa byed pa gtso bor 'dzin pa @193b de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'dzum pa mdzad par mthong ngo //
translated: Some gods and humans, who consider a smile to be the most important thing, see the Tathagata as smiling.

original: lha dang mi kha cig mdog gser gyi kha dog lta bu gtso bor byed pa de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa sku mdog gser gyi kha dog lta bur mthong ngo //

translated: Some gods and humans, who consider the golden color to be the most important thing, see the Tathagata as having a body the color of gold.

original: de bzhin du la las ni dngul gyi mdog tu mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du la las ni dngul gyi mdog tu mthong ngo //
translated: Similarly, some see him as the color of silver.

original: de bzhin du shel gyi mdog dang / bee d'ur+ya'i mdog dang / rdo'i snying po'i mdog dang / spug gi mdog dang / mu tig dmar po'i mdog dang / mu tig dkar po'i mdog dang / mdog dmar po dang / mdog dkar po dang / btsod ka'i mdog dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du shel gyi mdog dang / bee d'ur+ya'i mdog dang / rdo'i snying po'i mdog dang / spug gi mdog dang / mu tig dmar po'i mdog dang / mu tig dkar po'i mdog dang / mdog dmar po dang / mdog dkar po dang / btsod ka'i mdog dang /
translated: Similarly, they see him as the color of crystal, the color of lapis lazuli, the color of ruby, the color of coral, the color of red pearl, the color of white pearl, the color of red, the color of white, the color of vermilion,

original: mdog sngon po dang / mdog ser po dang / zla ba'i mdog dang / nyi ma'i mdog dang / ma'i mdog dang / 'od kyi mdog dang / brgya byin gyi mdog dang / tshangs pa'i mdog dang / ba mo'i mdog dang / ldong ros kyi mdog dang /
analyzed: mdog sngon po dang / mdog ser po dang / zla ba'i mdog dang / nyi ma'i mdog dang / ma'i mdog dang / 'od kyi mdog dang / brgya byin gyi mdog dang / tshangs pa'i mdog dang / ba mo'i mdog dang / ldong ros kyi mdog dang /
translated: Some saw the color of the sky, some saw the color of the ocean, some saw the color of gold, some saw the color of silver, some saw the color of sapphire, some saw the color of blue, some saw the color of yellow, some saw the color of the moon, some saw the color of the sun, some saw the color of mother-of-pearl, some saw the color of light, some saw the color of Indra, some saw the color of Brahma, some saw the color of snow, some saw the color of vermilion,

original: mtshal gyi mdog tu mthong ngo //
analyzed: mtshal gyi mdog tu mthong ngo //

translated: Some saw the color of water, some saw the color of the flowers of the coral tree, some saw the color of the champak flower, some saw the color of the jasmine flower, some saw the color of the varshika flower, some saw the color of the lotus, some saw the color of the blue lotus,

original: padma dkar po'i mdog dang / dpal gyi mdog dang / rnam thos kyi bu'i mdog dang / ngang ba'i rgyal bo ngang skya'i mdog dang // padma sar pa'i mdog dang / dpal gyi snying po'i mdog dang / rin po che byi ru'i mdog dang / nor bu rin po che'i mdog dang /
analyzed: padma dkar po'i mdog dang / dpal gyi mdog dang / rnam thos kyi bu'i mdog dang / ngang ba'i rgyal bo ngang skya'i mdog dang // padma sar pa'i mdog dang / dpal gyi snying po'i mdog dang / rin po che byi ru'i mdog dang / nor bu rin po che'i mdog dang /
translated: some saw the color of the white lotus, some saw the color of glory, some saw the color of Vaishravana, some saw the color of the king of geese, some saw the color of the red lotus, some saw the color of the essence of glory, some saw the color of coral, some saw the color of the precious jewel,🔽and some saw the color of the precious gem.

original: aan da rnyil @194a *//
analyzed: aan da rnyil @194a *//
translated: the color of sapphire,

original: gyi mdog dang / nam mkha' dag pa gzi brjid kyi mdog dang / lha dang mi kha cig yon tan gyi bsngags pa mtha' yas par mos bde dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i yon tan gyi sngags pa mtha' yas pa dang ldan par mthong ngo //
analyzed: gyi mdog dang / nam mkha' dag pa gzi brjid kyi mdog dang / lha dang mi kha cig yon tan gyi bsngags pa mtha' yas par mos bde dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i yon tan gyi sngags pa mtha' yas pa dang ldan par mthong ngo //
translated: the color of the pure sky, and some gods and humans see the Tathāgata’s body as endowed with infinite qualities of praise, through their faith in the infinite praise of his qualities.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /

original: de ltar yongs su brtag par nye bar bzung ste /🔽stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams sems can ji snyed yod pa dang / gang yang gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad mi'i lus thob par gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su brtag par nye bar bzung ste / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams sems can ji snyed yod pa dang / gang yang gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad mi'i lus thob par gyur la /
translated: Thus, taking this as an example,🔽all the sentient beings in the trichiliocosm, and all the sentient beings in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, having obtained human bodies,

analyzed: de'i nang nas sems can gcig gis sems can de dag ji snyed pa snyed la /
translated: among them, one sentient being, for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges, would make offerings to the Tathāgata with the five kinds of offerings,

translated: They contemplate the form, color, marks, shape, and deportment of the Tathāgata’s body, and they aspire to and accomplish it.

original: mngon par bsgrub la /
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub la /
translated: Just as one being does, so all those beings, each one, contemplate the form, color, marks, shape, and deportment of the Tathāgata’s body, and they aspire to and accomplish it.

original: sems can gcig gis sems kyi mos pa gang yin pa de sems can gnyis pa'i ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can gcig gis sems kyi mos pa gang yin pa de sems can gnyis pa'i ma yin te /
translated: The aspiration of one being is not the aspiration of another being.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śantimatī,

original: rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na /
translated: by this one of many explanations,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can de dag thams cad kyi sems @194b kyi mos pa tshim par mdzad de /
translated: the Tathāgata satisfies the aspirations of all those beings.

original: ji ltar mos pa bzhin du sems can de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i mdog dang / gzugs dang / rtags dang / dbyibs dang / spyod lam du shes mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mos pa bzhin du sems can de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i mdog dang / gzugs dang / rtags dang / dbyibs dang / spyod lam du shes mod kyi /
translated: In accordance with their aspirations, those sentient beings perceive the color, form, marks, shape, and conduct of the Tathāgata’s body.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'am /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'am /
translated: However, it is not the Tathāgata’s body

original: thugs kyi mdzad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thugs kyi mdzad pa ni ma yin te /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sngon gyi spyod pa yongs su sbyangs pa'i khyad par gyis lhun gyis grub pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sngon gyi spyod pa yongs su sbyangs pa'i khyad par gyis lhun gyis grub pas /
translated: The Tathāgata’s spontaneous activity is due to the special purification of his previous conduct.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi bsam pa tshim par mdzad pa'i gzugs dang / mdog dang / rtags dang / dbyibs dang / spyod lam gyis kun du bzhugs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi bsam pa tshim par mdzad pa'i gzugs dang / mdog dang / rtags dang / dbyibs dang / spyod lam gyis kun du bzhugs so //
translated: He abides in a form, color, mark, shape, and conduct that satisfies the mental aspirations of all sentient beings.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntimati,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this.

original: dper na / me long gi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa la gzugs su snang ba la ci 'dra ba nye bar bzhag pa de 'dra ba nyid kyi gzugs brnyan de na lhag chad med par mtshungs par snang yang /
analyzed: dper na / me long gi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa la gzugs su snang ba la ci 'dra ba nye bar bzhag pa de 'dra ba nyid kyi gzugs brnyan de na lhag chad med par mtshungs par snang yang /
translated: For example, in a completely clear mirror, a reflection appears that is similar to the form that is placed in front of it, without any difference in size.

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor ni mi sems mi rtog go /
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor ni mi sems mi rtog go /

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang mi dgongs mi rtog par lhun gyis grub pas sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi bsam pa'i rnam par rig pa tshim par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang mi dgongs mi rtog par lhun gyis grub pas sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi bsam pa'i rnam par rig pa tshim par mdzad de /
translated: in the same way, the Tathāgata, without thinking or conceptualizing, but spontaneously, satisfies the mental aspirations of all sentient beings.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba'o //
translated: this is the secret of the Tathāgata’s body.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni phung pos rab tu phye ba ma yin /🔽khams kyis rab tu phye ba ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni phung pos rab tu phye ba ma yin / khams kyis rab tu phye ba ma yin /
translated: furthermore, the Tathāgata’s body is not distinguished by the aggregates,🔽is not distinguished by the elements,

original: skye mched kyis rab tu phye ba ma yin /
analyzed: skye mched kyis rab tu phye ba ma yin /
translated: is not distinguished by the sense bases,

original: las las byung ba ma yin /
analyzed: las las byung ba ma yin /
translated: does not arise from karma,

original: nyon mongs pa las byung ba ma yin /🔽pha ma @195a *//
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las byung ba ma yin / pha ma @195a *//
translated: does not arise from the afflictions,

original: las byung ba ma yin /
analyzed: las byung ba ma yin /

analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i nur nur bo las byung ba ma yin /
translated: does not arise from the swelling of the great elements,

original: sha dang khrag gis g-yogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: sha dang khrag gis g-yogs pa ma yin /
translated: is not covered by flesh and blood,

original: rus pa dang chu ba'i bog des sbrel ba ma yin /
analyzed: rus pa dang chu ba'i bog des sbrel ba ma yin /
translated: is not connected by bones and sinews,🔽and

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba dang srog dang 'brel ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba dang srog dang 'brel ba ma yin te /
translated: The in-and-out breath is not connected with life.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni sku med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni sku med pa ste /
translated: the body of the Tathāgata is not a body.

original: chos kyi sku dang / gzugs dang / mtshan med pa'i sku dang / spros pa med cing rgyu ba med pa'i sku yin yang de gzugs dang mtshan gtso bor byed pa'i sems can sku bstan pas 'dul ba rnams kyi mig la snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku dang / gzugs dang / mtshan med pa'i sku dang / spros pa med cing rgyu ba med pa'i sku yin yang de gzugs dang mtshan gtso bor byed pa'i sems can sku bstan pas 'dul ba rnams kyi mig la snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the body of Dharma, the body without form or marks, the body without conceptual elaboration or movement. Yet it appears to the eyes of those beings who are to be guided by the teaching of a body, who make form and marks primary.

original: gzugs las dben pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid gtso bor byed pa'i sems can rnams la ni lha'i mig gis kyang thams cad kyi thams cad du bltar snang par mi 'gyur ro zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: gzugs las dben pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid gtso bor byed pa'i sems can rnams la ni lha'i mig gis kyang thams cad kyi thams cad du bltar snang par mi 'gyur ro zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: For those beings who make the characteristic of the Dharma, which is isolated from form, primary, it does not appear at all, even to the divine eye.

original: de la 'khor gcig tu 'dus pa'i sems can gyi nang nas kyang kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mthong /
analyzed: de la 'khor gcig tu 'dus pa'i sems can gyi nang nas kyang kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mthong /
translated: Śāntamati, even among the beings who have gathered in one assembly, some see the body of the Tathāgata,

original: kha cig gis ni mi mthong /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni mi mthong /
translated: some do not see it,

original: kha cig ni rgyang ring po na 'dug kyang mthong /
analyzed: kha cig ni rgyang ring po na 'dug kyang mthong /
translated: and some see it even from a great distance.

original: kha cig ni nye ba na 'dug kyang mi mthong /
analyzed: kha cig ni nye ba na 'dug kyang mi mthong /
translated: Some do not see it even when it is close by.

original: kha cig ni thag ring po na 'dug kyang mthong /
analyzed: kha cig ni thag ring po na 'dug kyang mthong /
translated: Some see it even when it is far away.

original: kha cig ni nye ba na 'dug kyang mi mthong ngo /
analyzed: kha cig ni nye ba na 'dug kyang mi mthong ngo /
translated: Some do not see it even when it is close by.

original: la las ni dran ba'i rnam pas mthong la g-yeng ba'i rnam pas mi mthong ngo //

translated: The Tathāgata’s portion of food would be in their bowls,

original: de lha de dag gis khyer nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dus pa'i sems can sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
analyzed: de lha de dag gis khyer nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dus pa'i sems can sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
translated: and the gods would carry it to the beings who had gathered in the Tathāgata’s assembly, who had previously planted the roots of virtue,

original: las kyi sgrib pa'i dbang gis skye gnas de dang de dag tu 'phangs pa /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa'i dbang gis skye gnas de dang de dag tu 'phangs pa /
translated: but who had been cast into various states of existence by the power of karmic obscurations,

original: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / zas mi rnyed pa /
analyzed: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / zas mi rnyed pa /
translated: and who had not found food or drink, and were weak from hunger.

original: bkres pas nyams chung bar gyur pa ji snyed pa de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bshos kyi pham phabs de byin nas sems can de dag gis kyang zas de zos pa dang / bkres skom dang bral te /
analyzed: bkres pas nyams chung bar gyur pa ji snyed pa de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bshos kyi pham phabs de byin nas sems can de dag gis kyang zas de zos pa dang / bkres skom dang bral te /
translated: The Tathāgata would give them the leftovers from his meal, and those beings would eat that food and be free from hunger and thirst.

original: bde zhing lus tshim nas bsam pa thag pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: bde zhing lus tshim nas bsam pa thag pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: They are satisfied and their bodies are content. They give rise to the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gang dag log par ltung ba yi dvags sam /
analyzed: gang dag log par ltung ba yi dvags sam /
translated: Those who are in the lower realms, the hungry ghosts,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten na gnas pa byang chub tu sems bskyed par mi nus pa de dag la yang de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten na gnas pa byang chub tu sems bskyed par mi nus pa de dag la yang de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: or the world of the Lord of Death, who are unable to give rise to the thought of awakening, for them it becomes the cause of nirvāṇa.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: rnam grangs 'dis na yang khyod kyis ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa zhal zas mi gsol zhing de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi zhal zas can du de ltar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis na yang khyod kyis ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa zhal zas mi gsol zhing de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi zhal zas can du de ltar rig par bya ste /
translated: by this one of many explanations, you should understand that the Tathāgata does not eat food, and that the Tathāgata is one who eats the food of the Dharma.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni sred med kyi bu ltar mkhregs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni sred med kyi bu ltar mkhregs pa /
translated: the Tathāgata’s body is as hard as Nārāyaṇa’s,

original: sra ba snying po can /
analyzed: sra ba snying po can /
translated: hard, solid, and indestructible,

original: mi shigs pa rdo rje'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi shigs pa rdo rje'i rang bzhin no //
translated: the nature of vajra.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ni pho ba dang / long ka med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ni pho ba dang / long ka med de /
translated: the Tathāgata’s body has no stomach or intestines,

original: rnag gam / khrag gam /🔽'chil ma'am / ngar snabs sam /🔽ngan skyugs sam /
analyzed: rnag gam / khrag gam / 'chil ma'am / ngar snabs sam / ngan skyugs sam /
translated: snot,🔽mucus,🔽vomit,

original: mi gtsang ba med kyi /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba med kyi /
translated: or any other filth.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: @201a *// de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni 'dzam bu'i chu bo'i gser gyi gar bu lta bu ste /
analyzed: @201a *// de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni 'dzam bu'i chu bo'i gser gyi gar bu lta bu ste /
translated: the body of the Tathāgata is like a lump of gold from the Jambū River.

original: khog stong ma yin /🔽ba spu'i bu ga med pa /
analyzed: khog stong ma yin / ba spu'i bu ga med pa /
translated: It is not hollow.🔽It has no pores.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: It is without fault.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: 'di ltar ci khyad rdo rje dang 'dra yang 'jam khyad ka tsa lin di ka ltar reg na bde bar 'gyur bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i che ba nyid la ltos /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci khyad rdo rje dang 'dra yang 'jam khyad ka tsa lin di ka ltar reg na bde bar 'gyur bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i che ba nyid la ltos /
translated: consider the greatness of the body of the Tathāgata, which is like a diamond, and yet is soft to the touch, like kācalindika.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /🔽gang gi tshe gzi brjid che ba /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros / gang gi tshe gzi brjid che ba /
translated: Śāntamati,🔽when the sons and daughters of gods, who are of great splendor,

original: gzi brjid che ba'i lha'i bu rnams dang / lha'i bu mo rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal ba na /
analyzed: gzi brjid che ba'i lha'i bu rnams dang / lha'i bu mo rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal ba na /
translated: bow down to the feet of the Tathāgata,

original: sngon ma reg pa'i reg pa reg nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: sngon ma reg pa'i reg pa reg nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
translated: they generate the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening after experiencing a touch that they have never felt before.

original: de dag nyon mongs pa bskyed par mi 'gyur ba'i dus de dang / tshod de yod do //
analyzed: de dag nyon mongs pa bskyed par mi 'gyur ba'i dus de dang / tshod de yod do //
translated: There will be a time and an occasion when they will not give rise to afflictions.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śantimatī,

original: sems can 'dod chags la spyod pa gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mthong ba de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mthong ma thag tu bdag nyid 'dod chags dang bral bar shes so //
analyzed: sems can 'dod chags la spyod pa gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mthong ba de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mthong ma thag tu bdag nyid 'dod chags dang bral bar shes so //
translated: those sentient beings who engage in desire, when they see the Tathāgata’s body, immediately upon seeing the Tathāgata’s body they will know themselves to be free from desire.

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa gang dag gis mthong na de dag byams pa thob bo //
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa gang dag gis mthong na de dag byams pa thob bo //
translated: Those who engage in hatred, when they see him, will attain love.

original: gti mug la spyod pa gang dag gis mthong na de dag ye shes kyi snang ba thob bo //
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa gang dag gis mthong na de dag ye shes kyi snang ba thob bo //
translated: Those who engage in delusion, when they see him, will attain the light of wisdom.

original: cha mnyam pa la spyod pa gang dag gis mthong na de dag nyon mongs pa dang bral bar shes so //
analyzed: cha mnyam pa la spyod pa gang dag gis mthong na de dag nyon mongs pa dang bral bar shes so //
translated: Those who engage in equal parts, when they see him, will know themselves to be free from afflictions.

original: ser sna can gang dag gis mthong na de dag gtong ba la mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ser sna can gang dag gis mthong na de dag gtong ba la mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are stingy, when they see him, will come to aspire to generosity.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba gang dag gis mthong na de dag tshul khrims la mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba gang dag gis mthong na de dag tshul khrims la mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have faulty discipline, when they see him, will come to aspire to discipline.

original: @201b gnod sems can gang dag gis mthong na de dag bzod pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: @201b gnod sems can gang dag gis mthong na de dag bzod pa 'thob bo //
translated: Those who are malicious will attain patience.

original: le lo can gang dag gis mthong na de dag brtson 'grus la mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: le lo can gang dag gis mthong na de dag brtson 'grus la mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are lazy will become devoted to diligence.

original: sems g-yeng ba gang dag gis mthong na de dag ting nge 'dzin 'thob bo //
analyzed: sems g-yeng ba gang dag gis mthong na de dag ting nge 'dzin 'thob bo //
translated: Those who are distracted will attain concentration.

original: shes rab 'chal pa gang dag gis mthong na de dag shes rab la mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa gang dag gis mthong na de dag shes rab la mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are unwise will become devoted to wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: mdor na sems can dkar po'i chos gang dang gang dag dang bral ba dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mthong ba de dang de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mthong ma thag tu mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad rgyun chad nas /
analyzed: mdor na sems can dkar po'i chos gang dang gang dag dang bral ba dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mthong ba de dang de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mthong ma thag tu mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad rgyun chad nas /
translated: in short, whatever wholesome qualities sentient beings lack, the moment they see the body of the Thus-Gone One, they will stop all unwholesome thoughts,

original: dge ba'i sems la rab tu gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems la rab tu gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: and their minds will be filled with virtue.

original: de la yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' zhing btang snyoms pa ste /
analyzed: de la yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' zhing btang snyoms pa ste /
translated: The Thus-Gone One is free of thoughts and is impartial toward all of them.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntimati,

original: 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba'o //
translated: This, Śāntamati, is the secret of the Tathāgata’s body.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa gang sprul pa de yang lhun gyis grub cing bsgrims pa mi mnga' ba dang / mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bas mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa gang sprul pa de yang lhun gyis grub cing bsgrims pa mi mnga' ba dang / mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bas mdzad de /
translated: the Tathāgata emanates emanations that are spontaneously accomplished, effortless, and non-agentive.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'di snyam du ngas sprul pa dag sprul to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'di snyam du ngas sprul pa dag sprul to //
translated: The Tathāgata does not think, ‘I emanate emanations.

original: sprul lo // sprul par bya'o snyam du mi dgongs mod kyi /🔽'on kyang sprul pas 'dul ba'i sems can ji snyed par 'jig rten gyi khams 'di 'am //
analyzed: sprul lo // sprul par bya'o snyam du mi dgongs mod kyi / 'on kyang sprul pas 'dul ba'i sems can ji snyed par 'jig rten gyi khams 'di 'am //
translated: I emanate. I will emanate.’

original: 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa brgya stong de dang de dag tu sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa de snyed du bzhud de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa brgya stong de dang de dag tu sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa de snyed du bzhud de /
translated: Nevertheless, as many emanations as there are beings to be trained, that many tathāgatas go to those and those world systems, to this world system, to countless hundreds of thousands of world systems, in order to bring about the maturation of beings.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: 'di yang @202a *//
analyzed: 'di yang @202a *//
translated: this, too,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba'o //
translated: is the secret of the Tathāgata’s body.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i don du sku las 'od kha dog du ma pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i don du sku las 'od kha dog du ma pa /
translated: In order to ripen sentient beings, the Tathāgata emits from his body many-colored

original: kha dog tha dad pa /
analyzed: kha dog tha dad pa /
translated: lights of different colors,

original: kha dog brgya stong pa dag byung ste /
analyzed: kha dog brgya stong pa dag byung ste /
translated: with a hundred thousand colors.

original: 'od des phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba byed pa de yang lhun gyis grub cing bsgrims pa mi mnga' ba dang / mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bas mdzad de /
analyzed: 'od des phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba byed pa de yang lhun gyis grub cing bsgrims pa mi mnga' ba dang / mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bas mdzad de /
translated: That light illuminates the buddha-fields of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river. That is done spontaneously, without effort, without exertion.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śhāntimati,

original: 'di'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba dang sku'i phrin las te /
analyzed: 'di'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba dang sku'i phrin las te /
translated: this is also the secret of the Tathāgata’s body and the activity of his body.

original: sku'i phrin las yongs su dag pa la 'jug pa cung zad tsam zhig bstan du zad kyi /
analyzed: sku'i phrin las yongs su dag pa la 'jug pa cung zad tsam zhig bstan du zad kyi /
translated: I have taught just a little bit about engaging in the complete purity of the activity of his body.

original: bskal pa'am de bas lhag par brjod kyang /
analyzed: bskal pa'am de bas lhag par brjod kyang /
translated: Even if one were to speak for an eon or more,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i phrin las yongs su dag pa'i yon tan bsngags pa'i mthar phyin par mi nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i phrin las yongs su dag pa'i yon tan bsngags pa'i mthar phyin par mi nus so //
translated: it would not be possible to reach the end of praising the qualities of the complete purity of the activity of the Tathāgata’s body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa 'di bshad pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa 'di bshad pa na /
translated: When this teaching of the inconceivable secret of the body of the Tathāgatas was explained,

original: srog chags khris ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: srog chags khris ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: ten thousand beings generated the thought of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' brgyad stong ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brgyad stong ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: Eight thousand bodhisattvas attained forbearance with regard to the non-arising of phenomena.

original: thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor nges kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dang / gsang ba ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la lha dang / mi'i me tog rnams kyis mngon par gtor to //
analyzed: thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor nges kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dang / gsang ba ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la lha dang / mi'i me tog rnams kyis mngon par gtor to //
translated: The entire assembly also scattered divine and human flowers over the Tathāgata and the Lord of Secrets Vajrapāṇi.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag g-yas pa gser gyi kha dog can brkyang ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag g-yas pa gser gyi kha dog can brkyang ste /
translated: The Blessed One extended his right hand, which was the color of gold,

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo @202b rje'i spyi bo la bzhag nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje khyod de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bstan pa 'di legs par smras pa legs so //
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo @202b rje'i spyi bo la bzhag nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje khyod de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bstan pa 'di legs par smras pa legs so //
translated: and placed it on the head of the Lord of Secrets Vajrapāṇi, saying, “Lord of Secrets Vajrapāṇi, you have spoken well of this teaching of the secret of the Tathāgatas.

original: legs so // de bzhin gshegs pas kyang snang zhing rjes su dgyes so //
analyzed: legs so // de bzhin gshegs pas kyang snang zhing rjes su dgyes so //
translated: The Tathagata also shines and delights.

original: zhes legs so zhes bya ba byin no //
analyzed: zhes legs so zhes bya ba byin no //
translated: Thus, Excellent! was given.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba'i le'us te bdun pa'o ////
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba'i le'us te bdun pa'o ////
translated: This is the seventh chapter on the secret of the Tathagata's body.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhi ba'i blo gros la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽zhi ba'i blo gros /🔽de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi gsang ba dang / gsung gi phrin las yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhi ba'i blo gros la 'di skad ces smras so // zhi ba'i blo gros / de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi gsang ba dang / gsung gi phrin las yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: The Lord of Secrets, Vajrapani, further said to the bodhisattva mahasattva Santimati, Santimati!

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: What is the secret of the Tathagata's speech and the purity of the activity of speech?

original: gang gi nub mo de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / gang gi nub mo len pa mi mnga' bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba de'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pas tha na yi ge'i 'bru gcig kyang ma gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi nub mo de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / gang gi nub mo len pa mi mnga' bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba de'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pas tha na yi ge'i 'bru gcig kyang ma gsungs so //
translated: From the night when the Tathāgata fully and completely awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment until the night when, without attachment, he will fully and completely pass beyond sorrow without leaving any remainder of the aggregates, during that time the Tathāgata has not uttered even a single syllable.

original: gsung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not utter any.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntimati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa ste /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la dbugs phyung ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa ste / de bzhin gshegs pa la dbugs phyung ba'am /
translated: the Tathāgata is always in equipoise.

original: rngub pa mi mnga'o //🔽rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: rngub pa mi mnga'o // rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: The Tathāgata does not exhale or inhale.🔽He does not conceptualize.

original: rnam par mi dpyod do //
analyzed: rnam par mi dpyod do //
translated: He does not analyze.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa med na ngag mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa med na ngag mi 'byung ste /
translated: Speech does not occur without conceptualization and analysis.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de yang rnam par mi rtog /🔽rnam par mi dpyod /🔽rtog par mi mdzad /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de yang rnam par mi rtog / rnam par mi dpyod / rtog par mi mdzad /
translated: The Tathāgata does not conceptualize.🔽He does not analyze.🔽He does not think.

original: rnam par rtog par mi mdzad /
analyzed: rnam par rtog par mi mdzad /
translated: He does not conceptualize.

original: mi gsung / mi @203a *//
analyzed: mi gsung / mi @203a *//
translated: He does not speak,🔽does not utter, does not express anything.

original: brjod / gsung bar mi mdzad kyang sems can rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: brjod / gsung bar mi mdzad kyang sems can rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: But sentient beings think,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gsung ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gsung ngo snyam mo //
translated: ‘The Tathāgata is speaking.’

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni shin tu mnyam par bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni shin tu mnyam par bzhag pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is completely in meditative equipoise.🔽He does not cognize anything at all, does not think anything at all, and does not conceptualize anything at all.

original: yi ge'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi thams cad du rnam par rig pa mi mdzad kyang sems can yi ge lhur len pa rnams 'di snyam du sems te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: yi ge'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi thams cad du rnam par rig pa mi mdzad kyang sems can yi ge lhur len pa rnams 'di snyam du sems te / de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: But sentient beings think,

original: bdag cag la chos ston to //
analyzed: bdag cag la chos ston to //
translated: ‘The Tathāgata is teaching the Dharma to us.

original: bdag cag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bstan pa kun shes so snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag cag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bstan pa kun shes so snyam mo //
translated: We understand the Tathāgata’s teaching of the Dharma.’

original: de la yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par mi rtog cing btang snyoms su mdzad do //
analyzed: de la yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par mi rtog cing btang snyoms su mdzad do //
translated: And in that case, the Tathāgata is nonconceptual and impartial.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntimati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshems dang / sgros dang / zhal gyi rkan dang / ljags dang / zhal gyi sgo nas sgra 'byung ba yang med la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshems dang / sgros dang / zhal gyi rkan dang / ljags dang / zhal gyi sgo nas sgra 'byung ba yang med la /
translated: the Tathāgata does not emit sounds from his teeth, lips, palate, tongue, or mouth,

original: 'byung bar yang grag go /
analyzed: 'byung bar yang grag go /
translated: but sounds are heard.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi sgra 'byung ba de ni nam mkha' las 'byung na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi sgra 'byung ba de ni nam mkha' las 'byung na /
translated: The sound of the Tathagata’s voice arises from space.

original: sems can rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: sems can rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Sentient beings think:
